summary: Email correspondence between an Assistant U.S. Attorney and FBI personnel regarding search warrant materials from the Epstein investigation. The AUSA is inquiring about the specific devices contained in two batches of evidence received in January and February 2020.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the initial inquiry, seeking information about which devices are contained in batches of search warrant returns received from the FBI.

persons.name: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: An FBI examiner who was in Greece the prior week and plans to call the AUSA to provide information about the search warrant materials.

connections.person1: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.person2: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
connections.description: Corresponding about evidence handling and information sharing regarding Epstein search warrant materials.

events.title: Receipt of search warrant returns batch
events.description: A significant batch of search warrant returns from the FBI was received by the U.S. Attorney's office.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner

events.title: Receipt of hard drive with materials
events.description: The AUSA received a hard drive containing another set of materials related to the Epstein investigation.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's office received a significant batch of search warrant returns from the FBI around January 13, 2020.
A second set of materials was delivered via hard drive in early February 2020.
The correspondence shows ongoing evidence handling and coordination between the SDNY and FBI in the Epstein investigation in early 2020.
An FBI forensic examiner was in Greece the week prior to this correspondence.
